channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- AI Engine
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- AI Engine

item.title: CVE-2024-6723|2024-09-13T15:30:32.161Z -- unknown -- ai%20engine
item.description: The AI Engine WordPress plugin before 2.4.8 does not properly sanitise and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, leading to a SQL injection exploitable by admin users when viewing chatbot discussions.

item.title: CVE-2024-6451|2024-08-19T17:10:21.720Z -- unknown -- ai%20engine
item.description: AI Engine < 2.4.3 is susceptible to remote-code-execution (RCE) via Log Poisoning. The AI Engine WordPress plugin before 2.5.1 fails to validate the file extension of "logs_path", allowing Administrators to change log filetypes from .log to .php.

item.title: CVE-2024-6451|2024-08-19T06:00:05.024Z -- unknown -- ai%20engine
item.description: AI Engine < 2.4.3 is susceptible to remote-code-execution (RCE) via Log Poisoning. The AI Engine WordPress plugin before 2.5.1 fails to validate the file extension of "logs_path", allowing Administrators to change log filetypes from .log to .php.

item.title: CVE-2024-6723|2024-09-13T06:00:02.961Z -- unknown -- ai%20engine
item.description: The AI Engine WordPress plugin before 2.4.8 does not properly sanitise and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, leading to a SQL injection exploitable by admin users when viewing chatbot discussions.
